parallel.distributed

Class DMsgPassingCoordinatorClt

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.distributed.DMsgPassingCoordinatorClt

  • public class DMsgPassingCoordinatorClt
extends java.lang.Object
    class implementing clients for message-passing between threads living in distributed JVMs. A thread wishing to send or receive a message to another thread (in the same or different JVM), invokes the sendData() or recvData() methods of this class which behave exactly as the shared-memory analogue in class parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String _coordName 
      private java.lang.String _host 
      private int _port 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DMsgPassingCoordinatorClt()
      default constructor assumes the coordinator server lives in the same host (localhost) listening in port 7894, and the name of the coordinator is "DMsgPassingCoordinator_7894".
      DMsgPassingCoordinatorClt(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String coordName)
      constructor specifies the host and port where the msg passing coordinator server lives, and also the name of the coordinator with whom all sends and receives will coordinate.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object recvData(int myid)
      works exactly as the corresponding method with same signature in parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator class, except that the data must be serializable.
      java.lang.Object recvData(int myid, int fromid)
      works exactly as the corresponding method with same signature in parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator class, except that the data must be serializable.
      void sendData(int myid, int toid, java.io.Serializable data)
      works exactly as the corresponding method with same signature in parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator class, except that the data must be serializable.
      void sendData(int myid, java.io.Serializable data)
      works exactly as the corresponding method with same signature in parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator class, except that the data must be serializable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DMsgPassingCoordinatorClt

        public DMsgPassingCoordinatorClt()
                          throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        default constructor assumes the coordinator server lives in the same host (localhost) listening in port 7894, and the name of the coordinator is "DMsgPassingCoordinator_7894".
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException

      • DMsgPassingCoordinatorClt

        public DMsgPassingCoordinatorClt(java.lang.String host,
                         int port,
                         java.lang.String coordName)
                          throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        constructor specifies the host and port where the msg passing coordinator server lives, and also the name of the coordinator with whom all sends and receives will coordinate.
        Parameters:
        host - String
        port - int
        coordName - String name of the coordinator instance in the server, to be used by threads sending and receiving msgs. Notice that it's possible for the same server to coordinate many different threads and processes via different names.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException
